item.title: TV Anime 'Youkai Apartment no Yuuga na Nichijou' Main Cast Members Announced
item.description: The official website for previously announced Youkai Apartment no Yuuga na Nichijou has announced main cast members. The main cast members will reprise from the drama CDs version, which not announced in previous news. The anime is slated for Summer 2017. Cast Yuushi Inaba: Atsushi Abe (Gunslinger Stratos: The Animation) Mizuki Hase: Yuuichi Nakamura (Atom: The Beginning) Source: Comic Natalie

item.title: Cast and Additional Staff for 'Mobile Suit Gundam: Twilight Axis' Announced
item.description: The official website for previously announced Mobile Suit Gundam: Twilight Axis has revealed cast and additional staff for the upcoming series. All six episodes of the net anime will stream exclusively on the Gundam Fan Club app every two weeks beginning June 23. Each episode will run for three minutes, with the exception of the last episode running for eight minutes. The first episode will be delivered free of charge on the Gundam Fan Club app, Gundam Info, Yatate Bunko's official website...

item.title: TV Anime 'Mahoujin Guru Guru: Magical Circle' Additional Cast Members Announced
item.description: The official website has announced additional cast members and theme song performers for Mahoujin Guru Guru: Magical Circle TV anime. Technoboys Pulcraft Green-Fund will compose the music for the TV anime, as well as perform the ending theme song with Bonjour Suzuki. The anime is slated for Summer 2017 via TV Tokyo. Cast Toma: Yukiyo Fujii (Amagi Brilliant Park) Gipple: Takahiro Sakurai (Seikaisuru Kado) Opening Theme Performance: ORESAMA Ending Theme Performance: Technoboys Pulcraft Green-Fund...

item.title: Light Novel 'Imouto sae Ireba Ii.' Gets TV Anime Adaptation for Fall 2017
item.description: An official website for light novel Imouto sae Ireba Ii. has launched and announced that the work will receive TV anime adaptation for Fall 2017. The seventh compiled volume, which will be released on May 18, will also include a second drama CD. Miyako Shirakawa, who was previously voiced by Risa Taneda (Strike the Blood) in the first drama CD, will be replaced by Ai Kakuma (Clockwork Planet) because of Taneda's Hiatus. Synopsis This is the story about the daily life of a young siscon nove...

item.title: TV Anime 'Ikemen Sengoku' Cast Information Revealed
item.description: An official teaser website for previously announced anime adaptation of Ikemen Sengoku: Toki wo Kakeru Koi otome game has opened and announced that it will be a new Wednesday short series that will air on Tokyo MX at 10:10 p.m. Each episode will run for 5 minutes starting July 12 under the title Ikemen Sengoku: Toki wo Kakeru ga Koi wa Hajimaranai (Ikemen Warring Country: The Time That Goes Through But Love Does Not Start). The anime will feature SD form of the characters and describes the ever...

item.title: Manga 'Ao no Exorcist' to Bundle Another OVA
item.description: Amazon Japan lists that 20th compiled volume of Ao no Exorcist manga, to be released on October 4, will bundle another OVA. According to New Akiba, the OVA will be based on Ao no Exorcist: Spy Game novel that released on March 2017. The novel features Renzou Shima, who is the main character, as the student in spy exorcist school. Ao no Exorcist is manga by Kazue Katou, which it began its serialization via Jump SQ on April 2009. The 19th compiled volume, which released on April 2017, included ep...

item.title: Winners of the 41st Kodansha Manga Awards
item.description: Publisher Kodansha announced on Tuesday the winners of its 41th annual manga awards in each of three categories. Winners are listed in bold alongside other nominated works. Shounen Shoukoku no Altair by Kotono Katou, publishing in Shounen Sirius Kishuku Gakkou no Juliet by Yousuke Kaneda, publishing in Bessatsu Shounen Magazine Enen no Shouboutai by Atsushi Ookubo, publishing in Weekly Shounen Magazine Dagashi Kashi by Kotoyama publishing in Shounen Sunday Shoujo P to JK by Maki Miyoshi, publish...

item.title: Mangaka and Illustrator Hinata Takeda Dies
item.description: Writer Kazuki Sakuraba mentioned on the official Gosick series blog on Tuesday that mangaka and illustrator Hinata Takeda died this January from an illness not mentioned. It was also announced in the June issue of Dragon Age magazine on Tuesday. Takeda was known as the illustrator of the Gosick light novel series and mangaka of the Ikoku Meiro no Croisée series, both of which received TV anime adaptations in 2011. She also published the manga Kitsune to Atori and Yuudachi Pool in her lif...

item.title: TV Anime 'Youkoso Jitsuryoku Shijou Shugi no Kyoushitsu e' Main Staff Members Announced
item.description: The official website for previously announced Youkoso Jitsuryoku Shijou Shugi no Kyoushitsu e (TV) has announced staff members. The anime is slated for Summer 2017. Staff Director: Seiji Kishi (Yuuki Yuuna wa Yuusha de Aru) x Hiroyuki Hashimoto (Mahou Shoujo Ikusei Keikaku) Series Composition: Aoi Akashiro (Fuuka) Character Design: Kazuaki Morita (Tsuki ga Kirei) Studio: Lerche Production: Youkoso Jitsuryoku Shijou Shugi no Kyoushitsu e Production Committee Source: Moca News

item.title: 'Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry' English Dub Cast Announced
item.description: American anime licensor Sentai Filmworks has announced English dub cast for Rakudai Kishi no Cavalry (Chivalry of a Failed Knight) on Friday. Christopher Ayres will direct the dub, with David Wald in charge of the script. Cast Ikki Kurogane: Clint Bickham Ikki Kurogane (Young), Renren Tomaru: Tiffany Grant Stella Vermillion: Luci Christian Shizuku Kurogane: Juliet Simmons Nagi Arisuin: Chris Patton Ayase Ayatsuji: Chelsea Ryan McCurdy Toka Todo: Stephanie Wittels Kurono Shinguuji: Kelly Manison...

item.description: Here is a collection of promotional videos (PVs), TV ads (CMs), and trailers for the last week. This thread excludes videos that have already been featured in an article. Please check the News Board, under the Preview tag, for articles that feature a promotional video. Last week's PV thread can be found here. item.title: TV Anime 'Gundam Build Fighters' to Receive New Project [Update 5/11]
item.description: The official website for Gundam Build Fighters series has released a PV for a new project titled Gundam Build Extra Battle Project on Sunday. It is still not clear if it is related to the remaining OVA that has been previously announced. Gundam Build Fighters is one of the Gundam series that received two TV series on Fall 2013 and Fall 2014. It has been previously announced that there will be two OVAs will be produced and so far a summer special has aired on TV on August 2016. PV Source: Offici...

item.title: Manga 'Taboo Tattoo' to End
item.description: Manga author Shinjirou has announced via his official Twitter account that manga Taboo Tattoo will end in the August issue of Comic Alive, releasing on June 27. Taboo Tattoo began its serialization in November 2009, and currently has 12 volumes in print, with the latest published in September 2016. The series has been published in English by Yen Press since January 2016, with the sixth volume shipped in North America on April 18. A 12-episode anime adaptation by J.C.Staff aired in Summer 2016, a...

item.title: 4-koma Manga 'Slow Start' Gets TV Anime
item.description: The cover of Manga Time Kirara's June 2017 issue has revealed that manga Slow Start will receive a TV anime adaptation. The issue officially goes on sale of May 9. Synopsis Hana Ichinose is a normal 16 year old high school student. However, there is something different about her: She enrolled in high school one year late! Her classmates are unaware of this, and Hana will have to work hard to catch up with everyone else. Slow Start is drawn by Yuiko Tokumi and began its serialization in Mang...

item.title: TV Anime 'Hina Logi: from Luck & Logic' Cast Members Announced
item.description: Previously announced Hina Logi: From Luck & Logic has announced cast members, theme songs, and revealed new PV via Machi☆Asobi vol. 18 on Saturday. Few cast members from the prequel will also reprise. The TV anime is scheduled to broadcast on Saturdays on July 1, 2017 via Tokyo MX, Sun TV, KBS Kyoto, BS 11, and TV Aichi. Cast Leones Yelistratova: Madoka Asahina (Little Witch Academia (TV)) Nina Alexandrovna: Hibiku Yamamura (Kiznaiver) Mahiro Kyoubashi: Natsumi Takamori (Brave Witches) Yayo...
